title: Area between curves with a parameter

content.prompt: The region bounded by the x-axis and the part of the graph of y = cos x between x = −π/2 and x = π/2 is separated into two regions by the line x = k. If the area of the region for -π/2 ≤ x ≤ k is three times the area of the region for k ≤ x , then k =

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using ƒ'(x), y', and dy/dx).
